column4: Hi, I'm trying to print pictures on a 4 x 6 paper.  When I go into the page setup and choose 4 x 6, but when i close it and reopen it it says 2.12 x 1.41 inch.  Why does this happen?  Does it make any sense?
ppi, Pixels per Inch, tsrk what are you modifying the image with, and are you saving the change?

I mean when I close (by clicking apply) the page setup dialog... and it happens in Gimp and the default photo editor (F-Spot i believe).  I don't actually close the image, just the page setup dialog, but when I try to print it prints the tiny 2 x 1.5 inch dimensions.
are you changing the ppi setting?  image Resolution or something like that.  /me loads gimp
not in the page setup.  I don't change anything else.  (There's very few options, just the printer, size, and orientation)
you are changing page setup?  you need to change image resolution.  Not sure how it is labeled or where to find it.
Do not change resize the image.  You only want the inches and ppi to change.  pixels should remain the same.
it has a DPI setting in the print dialogue, but i'm having this problem even before then.  All i want to do is make a 4 x 6 print, but it's always making it way to small.
i'm not change pixles, i'm changing inches
That's it.  DPI, Dots Per inch.  probably defaults to 75 dpi.
but it needs to print 4 x 6, and it's giving me 1200 dpi
page setup is for the printer.  Not the image.
you need to chnage the image settings.
ohh, ok, i see what you're saying, i'll try that
you see where it says resolution of 72 ppi?
yeah, i should set that to 1200 right?
don't set it based on the ppi.
resize the image, keeping the same pixel, but increasing the inches.  The result, the ppi will change.
ok, how do I do that?
in other words, you want to scale without resizing.
yeah, how do i tell it to keep pixles constant though?
I could show you if I had gimp,   I guess I could install on this tiny crappy laptop.
